author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Food initiative combatting hunger provides relief for 50 Esparto households, César Chávez youth essay contest
text: A research initiative to combat hunger and improve nutrition for families living in affordable housing communities and food deserts is being launched through a partnership with No Kid Hungry, Instacart and Mercy Housing. The program includes 50 households each at two affordable housing communities in Esparto and Stockton, and 100 households at a third community in Savannah, Georgia, according to a press release. “Through the program, 200 familie… 54 minutes agoRead Full Article Think freely.Subscribe and get full access to Ground NewsSubscriptions start at $9.99/year [Subscribe](/subscribe) Not enough coverage to generate an Article Assistant.
